data.title: Not impressed
data.text: This was my first time at Jamba Juice and I was not impressed.  I got the Aloha Pineapple smoothie and I didn't taste any pineapple.  Also, i thought the smoothies were all natural, but it seemed like they were pumped with fake tasting flavor.  It was more runny than I expected too!  I probably won't be back.

data.title: Grab and Go
data.text: Great healthy options for breakfast or afternoon snack. Specifically noting the Acai Bowl which was delicious. This is very popular out west and I haven't seen a lot of places that make them in the East. I have been to a few Jamba Juice locations and this is the only one that I've seen this menu item. Delicious

data.title: Juice not Smoothies
data.text: I ordered a smoothie and got an $8 fruit juice with a sprinkle of kale and mango(payed more for extra kale).  Disappointed :(

data.title: Jamba Wonderful
data.text:
We are veterans of Jamba Juice and were pleased to note they are in Charlotte.

The main point on this store is how professional the staff were on our stop. I was most impressed.  My wife tried a new flavor  - for her - the staff member invited her to try it before we departed the store - he offered to make her another one if not to her liking - that is quality customer service  - well done! 

All of ours were up to the level of excellence one expects from Jamba Juice.

We were traveling on I - 85- this location is a short distance away from the interstate and a welcome and tasty treat for many miles driving...

data.title: Jamba
data.text: They could decrease the sugar levels in their drinks. Otherwise, they are quite great and very friendly.
